responsibleParties.organisationName: Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques - Centre Europeen de Recherche et Formation Avancees en Calcul Scientifique.

subComponents.description: TRIP (Oki and Sud 1998) is a river routing model used to convert the daily runoff simulated by ISBA into river discharge on the global river channel network at 1° resolution. It is a simple linear model based on a single prognostic equation for the water mass within each grid cell of the hydrologic network. The runoff from ISBA is fed to TRIP every day and TRIP is integrated with a 3-hour time step.

citations.title: Oki and Sud 1998
citations.collectiveTitle: Oki, Taikan, Y. C. Sud, 1998: Design of Total Runoff Integrating Pathways (TRIP) - A Global River Channel Network. Earth Interact., 2, 1–37.

subComponents.description:
ISBA is a process-based force-restore method to calculate the time evolution of the surface energy and water
140 budgets including snow pack evolution based on a one-layer scheme. The soil hydrology is represented by three layers (a thin surface layer included in the rooting layer and a third layer to distinguish between the rooting depth and the total soil depth), which ensure the vertical water exchange between the land surface and the atmosphere. The soil water content varies with surface infiltration, soil evaporation, plant transpiration and deep drainage. The infiltration rate is computed as the difference between the through-fall rate and the surface runoff. The through-fall rate is the sum of rainfall not intercepted by the canopy, dripping from the interception reservoir and snowmelt from the snow pack. A comprehensive parameterization of sub-grid hydrology to account for the heterogeneity of precipitation, topography, soil depth and vegetation within each grid cell is used to improve the ISBA’s runoff simulation (Decharme and Douville 2007). Every day of the simulation, this total runoff (surface runoff + deep drainage) simulated by ISBA is fed into TRIP (see River Routing section)

Part I: Comparison to GRACE Terrestrial Water Storage Estimates and In Situ River Discharges, Journal of hydromet., 11(3),583-600, doi:10.1175/2010JHM1211.1

subComponents.longName: "SURface EXternalisee" in French (Externalized surface platform) for land

properties.description: For water treatment, see TRIP river routing and land surface lakes sections

Variables coming from ARPEGE :
 - at forcing level : air temperature, specific humidity, wind components, surface pressure, dry air density 
 - height of model interlayers
 - cosine of zenithal angle at t anf cosine of zenithal angle at t+1
 - liquid precipitation surface 
 - snow precipitation surface
Orography map computed at the model resolution from the GTOPO30  orography model  at 1km resolution .

Variables coming from ARPEGE :
solar spectral bands
surface downward longwave radiation
surface downward diffuse solar radiation for each spectral band
surface downward direct solar radiation for each spectral band
River flow direction at 1° resolution from Oki and Sud (1998)
River sequence at 1° resolution from Oki and Sud (1998)
Soil textural properties as clay and sand content from the FAO database at 1km resolution
Daily sea surface temperature extrapolated from the NEMO oceanic model for sea flux scheme
Spinup for soil moisture, soil temperature, snow water equivalent, and all other prognostic variables
TOPMODEL Topographic Index from the HYDRO1K database at 1km resolution

Vegetation map from the ECOCLIMAP database at 1km resolution in order to compute all vegetation and soil properties such as LAI, albedo (UV, IR, VI), root and soil depth, the fraction of each vegetation type, the roughness length, ...
Daily water surface temperature extrapolated from the NEMO oceanic model for lake flux scheme

subComponents.description: Includes a Langmuir cell parameterization [Axell 2002], the Mellor and Blumberg [2004] surface wave breaking parameterization, and has a time discretization which is energetically consistent with the ocean model equations [Burchard 2002, Marsaleix et al. 2008] ; See NEMO doc for references.
